post.body: the problem is that's what I selected in Flex Builder! It still launches IE for me...
excellent blog post, btw. Does Rylan have a twitter account?
real men never sleep, crack toilets with their stream and eat candy unwrapped :)
please let me know how it goes with SL and WebORB
nevermind, we're using Blob
Do you have any pointers on creating a persistent store in Azure that survives AppDomain restarts?
I clearly do not like it. Maybe you will find something for yourself:) To me it is a major overkill. Things can be done simpler
Fantastic news!
not at the moment. If you're using django though, check out DjangoAMF: http://tinyurl.com/5an4z4
That's the midnight coding spirit!
you're funny! For many Silverlight is becoming the "Second Life". We're seeing it getting a LOT more traction.
Let me know if there are any health emergencies as a result of that lunch. If not, I'll go with you next time ;)
yes, i already discovered these two. It is amazing that these are the only two quality posts in the ocean of other crap
Thank you! I wanted to learn about it for quite some time.
send me an email with some sample code.
Not that I know of. Are you experiencing an error?
if you use getDefinitionByName in ActionScript, make sure the components resolved by the API are referenced elsewhere in the code.
Amazon is running some super deals on children toys if anyone still has not done their xmas shopping.
Flex Builder team, please implement Ctrl+G the way ALL other IDEs implement it! It is supposed to do "go to line in the code"
Was reading about Ponzi schemes this morning. Evil geniuses. Fascinating stuff.
Flex Builder does not respect the "default browser" setting. I configured Chrome to be the default, but Flex Builder still launches IE
Slowly progressing through the PDF generator user guide. What started as a framework for Flex became a full system for all types of clients
Off to get fresh donuts for kiddos breakfast
Got up earlier to finish some documentation work from yesterday.
w00t! dynamic assembly upload and invocation in Azure is working!
Consulting companies should be banned from creating product frameworks. Convince me the true driver for Cairngorm were not billable hours!
Someone asked me to review their Cairngorm-based code. Wish I had done that before lunch. Vomit-inducing exercise. What a clusterf@ck!
That is in WebORB Service Browser...
Major breakthrough! We managed to show in service browser a dynamically uploaded .NET assembly in Azure. Invocation handling is next
Having hard time configuring MSI installer. Some basic things are made SO complicated.
Enjoying some early morning hacking.
PDF Gen User guide - check, Flex, Flash, AJAX, Silverlight examples - check, Installer - check, FAQ - check. Need just a few more test runs.
Fun part of the work we're doing is porting the examples across all client technologies. Flex,Flash and AJAX are done, working on SL now
I wonder why Adobe makes Flex Builder extensibility such a big secret. Finding any kind of info on the subject is a major PIA.
Feels very weird working with Flash after all the time you spent with Flex Builder
Time to go to bed. It's been a very productive day. Docs are done. Now moving to release..but it will be tomorrow.
User guide is done. Polishing examples now. Very excited about this new product we're coming out with.
There is no way to configure sites with "good" popups in Chrome. That makes it PIA when you're debugging a feature that relies on popups
Looks like Acrobat 9 for Mac has a problem rendering Flash content. The same PDF works just fine on Windows
DM me if you want to participate in a kinda cool "Flash in PDF" test.
